snippet: About a dozen countries hit hard by AIDS have reached a “tipping point” that means they are winning their battles against the disease, according to a new analysis.
abstract: Analysis by AVAC, organization that lobbies for AIDS prevention and treatment, shows that several African countries hit hard by AIDS have begun winning war against disease; world as whole, however, is losing fight.
lead_paragraph: About a dozen countries hit hard by AIDS have reached a “tipping point” that means they are winning their battles against the disease, according to a new analysis.
